title: Latin (0900 ca.) Weimar Gospels - Luke and John - Illuminated (WDL-13462)
title_vernacular: Evangelia Vimariensia (0900 ca., Lucas et Ioannes)
description:
Latin (0900 ca.) Weimar Gospels - Luke and John - Illuminated (WDL-13462)

The Weimar Gospels manuscript, dating back to around 900 AD, is a significant historical document containing the gospels of Luke and John. This manuscript was originally part of a larger gospel book, with a fragment now preserved in Weimar, which includes prologues, canon tables, and the gospels of Matthew and Mark, along with an introduction (argumentum) and summary (breviarium) for Luke.

Each gospel in the manuscript is introduced by a portrait of the respective evangelist and a full-page initial, indicative of the manuscript's high quality and artistic value. The craftsmanship and stylistic features suggest that it was produced by an influential scriptorium, likely under the influence of the renowned Saint Gallen scriptorium, with a possible origin at Mainz.

This manuscript represents a pivotal period in medieval scriptorium art and illuminates the religious and cultural practices of the time. Its preservation and detailed artistry provide valuable insight into the early medieval approach to gospel transcription and illumination.
